intro: Centronia vaupesana, commonly known as the Vaupesana centronia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
